qas.question: What are Tucson's typical winter high temperatures?
What are Tucson's typical winter low temperatures?
What do Tucson's hard freeze temperatures dip to?
How much snow did Tucson get on Feb 20, 2013?
When had Tucson last had as much snow as 2013?

context: Winters in Tucson are mild relative to other parts of the United States. Daytime highs in the winter range <a0_0>between 64 and 75 °F (18 and 24 °C)<a0_0/>, with overnight lows <a1_0>between 30 and 44 °F (−1 and 7 °C)<a1_0/>. Tucson typically averages one hard freeze per winter season, with temperatures dipping to <a2_0>the mid or low-20s (−7 to −4 °C)<a2_0/>, but this is typically limited to only a very few nights. Although rare, snow has been known to fall in Tucson, usually a light dusting that melts within a day. The most recent snowfall was on February 20, 2013 when <a3_0>2.0 inches<a3_0/> of snow blanketed the city, the largest snowfall since <a4_0>1987<a4_0/>.
